txt.en: You see a few tracks, but nothing recent. It seems the tomb-robbers have not gained entry either
You have located the ruins of Arthobel
Arthobel sits high upon the hills above the Way of Kings. Were the robbers to find their way in, it would provide a very strategic viewpoint.

'I have been watching the robbers as they have moved about the hills above us. They seem to focus on two primary ruins, Tham Sarch and Tham Laegamon. I know from my days as a child playing in those hills of a third ruin: Arthobel.

'The tower that stands there would make for a very strategic position. You could clearly see over the Way of Kings below you, watch the waters of the Baranduin to the south-east, and on a clear day, see Tinnudir.

'Last I remember, the heavy doors to that place were sealed tight, and none had been within in many years. I ask you to venture to the south-west, up into the hills, to the entrance and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> around to see if you notice any recent activity there.'
Arthobel is south-west of the Ranger-encampment in the Way of Kings.\n\nMaladan asked you to scout the ruins of Arthobel to see if the tomb-robbers are actively using it.
'So they have not yet found a way in either? That plays to our advantage.'
Maladan is at the Ranger-camp in the Way of Kings.\n\nMaladan will be pleased to hear the tomb-robbers have not gained access to Arthobel.
'I believe Arthobel was once lived in by an ancient relative of mine, but the records to prove it are long since lost.'
